channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Brand Visibility in Packaging: A Deep Learning Approach for Logo Detection, Saliency-Map Prediction, and Logo Placement Analysis
item.description: In the third step, by integrating logo detection with a saliency map generation, the framework provides a comprehensive brand attention score.

item.title: UniCtrl: Improving the Spatiotemporal Consistency of Text-to-Video Diffusion Models via Training-Free Unified Attention Control
item.description: Video Diffusion Models have been developed for video generation, usually integrating text and image conditioning to enhance control over the generated content.

item.title: Vision-RWKV: Efficient and Scalable Visual Perception with RWKV-Like Architectures
item.description: Transformers have revolutionized computer vision and natural language processing, but their high computational complexity limits their application in high-resolution image processing and long-context analysis.

item.title: Beyond Specialization: Assessing the Capabilities of MLLMs in Age and Gender Estimation
item.description: Furthermore, we attempted various ways to fine-tune the ShareGPT4V model for this specific task, aiming to achieve state-of-the-art results in this particular challenge.

item.title: AllSpark: Reborn Labeled Features from Unlabeled in Transformer for Semi-Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: We further introduce a Semantic Memory along with a Channel Semantic Grouping strategy to ensure that unlabeled features adequately represent labeled features.

item.title: Beyond Specialization: Assessing the Capabilities of MLLMs in Age and Gender Estimation
item.description: Furthermore, we attempted various ways to fine-tune the ShareGPT4V model for this specific task, aiming to achieve state-of-the-art results in this particular challenge.

item.title: NusaBERT: Teaching IndoBERT to be Multilingual and Multicultural
item.description: Indonesia's linguistic landscape is remarkably diverse, encompassing over 700 languages and dialects, making it one of the world's most linguistically rich nations.

item.title: EEE-QA: Exploring Effective and Efficient Question-Answer Representations
item.description: Current approaches to question answering rely on pre-trained language models (PLMs) like RoBERTa.

item.title: Matrix Completion with Convex Optimization and Column Subset Selection
item.description: We present two algorithms that implement our Columns Selected Matrix Completion (CSMC) method, each dedicated to a different size problem.

item.title: VTG-GPT: Tuning-Free Zero-Shot Video Temporal Grounding with GPT
item.description: Video temporal grounding (VTG) aims to locate specific temporal segments from an untrimmed video based on a linguistic query.

item.title: Fourier-basis Functions to Bridge Augmentation Gap: Rethinking Frequency Augmentation in Image Classification
item.description: However, common visual augmentations might not guarantee extensive robustness of computer vision models.

item.title: Hybrid Quantum Neural Network Advantage for Radar-Based Drone Detection and Classification in Low Signal-to-Noise Ratio
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the performance of a Hybrid Quantum Neural Network (HQNN) and a comparable classical Convolution Neural Network (CNN) for detection and classification problem using a radar.

item.title: EAGLE: Eigen Aggregation Learning for Object-Centric Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation has innately relied on extensive pixel-level labeled annotated data, leading to the emergence of unsupervised methodologies.

item.title: a-DCF: an architecture agnostic metric with application to spoofing-robust speaker verification
item.description: Spoofing detection is today a mainstream research topic.

item.title: Can Poverty Be Reduced by Acting on Discrimination? An Agent-based Model for Policy Making
item.description: We classify policies as discriminatory or non-discriminatory against the poor, with the support of specialized NGOs, and we observe the results in the AABM in terms of the impact on wealth inequality.

item.title: Neural Graph Generator: Feature-Conditioned Graph Generation using Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: Graph generation has emerged as a crucial task in machine learning, with significant challenges in generating graphs that accurately reflect specific properties.

item.title: Leveraging Biomolecule and Natural Language through Multi-Modal Learning: A Survey
item.description: The integration of biomolecular modeling with natural language (BL) has emerged as a promising interdisciplinary area at the intersection of artificial intelligence, chemistry and biology.

item.title: Improving LLM Code Generation with Grammar Augmentation
item.description: We present SynCode a novel framework for efficient and general syntactical decoding of code with large language models (LLMs).

item.title: DNA Family: Boosting Weight-Sharing NAS with Block-Wise Supervisions
item.description: Addressing this problem, we modularize a large search space into blocks with small search spaces and develop a family of models with the distilling neural architecture (DNA) techniques.

item.title: LLM-PQ: Serving LLM on Heterogeneous Clusters with Phase-Aware Partition and Adaptive Quantization
item.description: The immense sizes of LLMs have led to very high resource demand and cost for running the models.

item.title: A Two-Stage Algorithm for Cost-Efficient Multi-instance Counterfactual Explanations
item.description: Counterfactual explanations constitute among the most popular methods for analyzing the predictions of black-box systems since they can recommend cost-efficient and actionable changes to the input to turn an undesired system's output into a desired output.

item.title: Improving the Validity of Automatically Generated Feedback via Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Second, we propose a framework for feedback generation that optimizes both correctness and alignment using reinforcement learning (RL).

item.title: OpenGraph: Towards Open Graph Foundation Models
item.description: By effectively capturing the graph's underlying structure, these GNNs have shown great potential in enhancing performance in graph learning tasks, such as link prediction and node classification.

item.title: Augmenting Automation: Intent-Based User Instruction Classification with Machine Learning
item.description: Our system represents user instructions as intents, allowing for dynamic control of electrical circuits without relying on predefined commands.

item.title: Emotion Analysis in NLP: Trends, Gaps and Roadmap for Future Directions
item.description: We then discuss four lacunae: (1) the absence of demographic and cultural aspects does not account for the variation in how emotions are perceived, but instead assumes they are universally experienced in the same manner; (2) the poor fit of emotion categories from the two main emotion theories to the task; (3) the lack of standardized EA terminology hinders gap identification, comparison, and future goals; and (4) the absence of interdisciplinary research isolates EA from insights in other fields.

item.title: ParallelPARC: A Scalable Pipeline for Generating Natural-Language Analogies
item.description: We demonstrate our pipeline and create ProPara-Logy, a dataset of analogies between scientific processes.

item.title: A Compositional Typed Semantics for Universal Dependencies
item.description: We introduce UD Type Calculus, a compositional, principled, and language-independent system of semantic types and logical forms for lexical items which builds on a widely-used language-general dependency syntax framework.

item.title: Benchmarking Segmentation Models with Mask-Preserved Attribute Editing
item.description: We evaluate a broad variety of semantic segmentation models, spanning from conventional close-set models to recent open-vocabulary large models on their robustness to different types of variations.

item.title: NeRF-VPT: Learning Novel View Representations with Neural Radiance Fields via View Prompt Tuning
item.description: Furthermore, the cascading learning of NeRF-VPT introduces adaptability to scenarios with sparse inputs, resulting in a significant enhancement of accuracy for sparse-view novel view synthesis.

item.title: Training Unbiased Diffusion Models From Biased Dataset
item.description: While directly applying it to score-matching is intractable, we discover that using the time-dependent density ratio both for reweighting and score correction can lead to a tractable form of the objective function to regenerate the unbiased data density.

item.title: FaiMA: Feature-aware In-context Learning for Multi-domain Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: While existing research narrowly focuses on single-domain applications constrained by methodological limitations and data scarcity, the reality is that sentiment naturally traverses multiple domains.

item.title: Accelerating Greedy Coordinate Gradient via Probe Sampling
item.description: Safety of Large Language Models (LLMs) has become a central issue given their rapid progress and wide applications.

item.title: DINER: Debiasing Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis with Multi-variable Causal Inference
item.description: However, most of the present debiasing methods focus on single-variable causal inference, which is not suitable for ABSA with two input variables (the target aspect and the review).

item.title: Pairwise Alignment Improves Graph Domain Adaptation
item.description: Graph-based methods, pivotal for label inference over interconnected objects in many real-world applications, often encounter generalization challenges, if the graph used for model training differs significantly from the graph used for testing.

item.title: Polynormer: Polynomial-Expressive Graph Transformer in Linear Time
item.description: To enable the base model permutation equivariant, we integrate it with graph topology and node features separately, resulting in local and global equivariant attention models.

item.title: STAR: Constraint LoRA with Dynamic Active Learning for Data-Efficient Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models
item.description: For poor model calibration, we incorporate the regularization method during LoRA training to keep the model from being over-confident, and the Monte-Carlo dropout mechanism is employed to enhance the uncertainty estimation.

item.title: Reading Subtext: Evaluating Large Language Models on Short Story Summarization with Writers
item.description: We evaluate recent Large language Models (LLMs) on the challenging task of summarizing short stories, which can be lengthy, and include nuanced subtext or scrambled timelines.

item.title: Can a Confident Prior Replace a Cold Posterior?
item.description: First, we introduce a "DirClip" prior that is practical to sample and nearly matches the performance of a cold posterior.

item.title: Rethinking Inductive Biases for Surface Normal Estimation
item.description: Despite the growing demand for accurate surface normal estimation models, existing methods use general-purpose dense prediction models, adopting the same inductive biases as other tasks.

item.title: Distributional Dataset Distillation with Subtask Decomposition
item.description: What does a neural network learn when training from a task-specific dataset?

item.title: Fast and Efficient Local Search for Genetic Programming Based Loss Function Learning
item.description: In this paper, we develop upon the topic of loss function learning, an emergent meta-learning paradigm that aims to learn loss functions that significantly improve the performance of the models trained under them.

item.title: PoTeC: A German Naturalistic Eye-tracking-while-reading Corpus
item.description: The Potsdam Textbook Corpus (PoTeC) is a naturalistic eye-tracking-while-reading corpus containing data from 75 participants reading 12 scientific texts.

item.title: Learning with Logical Constraints but without Shortcut Satisfaction
item.description: In this paper, we present a new framework for learning with logical constraints.

item.title: MaskLRF: Self-supervised Pretraining via Masked Autoencoding of Local Reference Frames for Rotation-invariant 3D Point Set Analysis
item.description: Following the successes in the fields of vision and language, self-supervised pretraining via masked autoencoding of 3D point set data, or Masked Point Modeling (MPM), has achieved state-of-the-art accuracy in various downstream tasks.

item.title: Graph Construction with Flexible Nodes for Traffic Demand Prediction
item.description: To tackle these challenges, this paper introduces a novel graph construction method tailored to free-floating traffic mode.

item.title: Peacock: A Family of Arabic Multimodal Large Language Models and Benchmarks
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have proven effective in a wide range of tasks requiring complex reasoning and linguistic comprehension.

item.title: Self-Consistent Decoding for More Factual Open Responses
item.description: We compare this "Sample & Select" method to greedy decoding, beam search, nucleus sampling, and the recently introduced hallucination avoiding decoders of DoLA, P-CRR, and S-CRR.

item.title: Imitation Learning Datasets: A Toolkit For Creating Datasets, Training Agents and Benchmarking
item.description: Imitation learning field requires expert data to train agents in a task.

item.title: Rethinking Few-shot 3D Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The former arises from non-uniform point sampling, allowing models to distinguish the density disparities between foreground and background for easier segmentation.

item.title: VisionLLaMA: A Unified LLaMA Interface for Vision Tasks
item.description: Large language models are built on top of a transformer-based architecture to process textual inputs.
